pullrequest.title: Preparations for apps to be restructured as standard Python packages

content.raw:
> As opposed to just letting the user put their code anywhere?

Yep. And if we are to encourage the use of a labscriptlib and/or analysislib directory, these can simply live in `labscript_suite_profile` now that the programs themselves won’t be there. The recommended structure could be something like:

```
<labscript_suite_profile>/
├── labconfig/
├── analysislib/
├── labscriptlib/
```

In any case, the existence and location of userlib, analysislib, and labscriptlib are inessential conventions, and so more essential functionality \(like locating labconfig\) shouldn’t depend on them, even if they are created at install.
